dialogue.text: I tap on Kirin’s name in my phone and wait for her to answer.
Whenever the two of us hang out, it’s usually something along the lines of me going over to {i}her{/i} part of town and just...killing time however {i}she{/i} wants to that day.
But I feel like we’ve gotten close enough at this point that she’d be willing to hang out at my place instead.
Now, knowing Kirin, it’s highly possible that she’s been waiting for me to invite her over this entire time-
But it’s not exactly easy finding an opportunity to bring over a girl from another class, and there’s no way Ami wouldn’t be suspicious of that if she caught it happening.
As such, today might be the only chance I have for a while to actually follow through with the idea, as her and some of the others are going shopping in the urban district of Kumon-mi.
Hey~ Whatcha up to?
Heading back to my place. You?
What a coincidence. I’m {i}also{/i} heading back to my place.
Wow. Maybe this is some sort of sign?
Maybe it is! Are you suggesting we hang out?
I suppose I might be. Do you have any objections to coming over my place this time?
Uhh...where do you even live?
Do you know where Ayane lives?
Yeah. You’re over there?
No. Nowhere near it, actually.
...Then why would you even bring that up?
I’ll just text you the address. You can make it in less than an hour coming from your apartment.
You’ve been traveling that far just to meet up with me this whole time?
Yeah. I’m so kind, aren’t I?
That or you just really like walking.
Is Ami home right now? Or is this the same kind of secret meeting we have when you come over my place?
I would absolutely not invite you over if Ami was there.
Ouch.
But yeah, text me the address. I’ll head over now.
We’re ordering food, though. I’m starving.
Deal.
Sweet. See you soon, [kirinmaster]~
The call comes to an end and I immediately send Kirin my address.
She doesn’t respond, but I guess there’s not really any reason to, considering a street name and some numbers aren’t a great start to a conversation.
The walk back is a cold one. The wind is out in full force today.
I feel kind of bad for making Kirin bear this all the way over, but one of us was going to wind up suffering through it no matter what.
I’ll just make it up to her by buying her dinner whenever we decide on something to order.
Thanks for having me~
Kirin lets herself in once I give her the okay and slides her boots off at the door before gleefully trotting up to me.
Your cheeks are bright red. You’re not nervous about being alone in my house, are you?
No, I'm just cold.
Also, what the fuck is a canola and how do they get the oil out of it? Do you ever wonder that, Sensei?
Jokes on you, Kirin. I'm {i}always{/i} wondering.
Well, if you need a warm blanket or a mug of hot cacao to warm yourself up, just let me know. My primary concern is making you feel safe and welcome.
Wait, no. Answer the canola question. It's important.
I can't, Kirin. Knowing the truth would only make you too powerful.
Sensei-
Do you want the cacao or not?
...Yes please.
I will put the kettle on right away.
But, uhh...now that {i}that’s{/i} out of the way, what did you want to eat for dinner?
I was thinking we could just order from a bunch of different places and then split whatever the cost is.
Absolutely not. Allow me to front the bill as both your teacher and closest friend.
This is really awkward.
It is, but I’m definitely not taking the blame for it this time.
I know. I’m clearly less prepared than I thought I’d be for something like this.
So, dinner.
Right, dinner.
Well, that was not exactly the start to this visit that I was expecting.
It was...nice seeing Kirin be honest about something that wasn’t entirely malicious or confusing for once, though.
It’s probably the first thing I’ve seen her do that I can actually say I understand.
The two of us proceed to flip through a number of takeout menus that Ami and I keep on top of the microwave, ordering from a grand total of four of them.
I don’t take Kirin up on her offer to split the bill and decide to pay for everything myself, figuring I can keep any leftovers and just...eat them throughout the week.
And, within forty-five minutes or so, our feast is finally ready to begin.
So, uhh...That was kind of weird before, right?
I mean, like...what if {i}Canola{/i} is just the name of the brand?
You really don’t have to keep bringing this up, Kirin. We can just eat now.
Ahhhhh I know that!
I just feel so immature all of a sudden and I don’t like it.
Can’t you just come out and admit something equally embarrassing so I can get over this?
I...can’t really think of anything that embarrassing, to be honest.
What, you never like, accidentally called your teacher Mom or anything?
Surprisingly, no.
Jesus, how boring is your life?
It's not boring. It's fulfilling, calm, and full of hugs. Just the way I want it.
Yeah, yeah...I get it. I'm just feeling a little off today.
Well I hope that the cacao you drank offscreen helped.
It did.
Yeah, I’m pretty sure I just needed sugar or something.
I’m feeling a lot better now and I’m literally like two inches away from you.
Do you want a hug after we’re done eating?
Ah! Hug! I love hugs!
That’s gotta be worth dinner and those five minutes of counseling I needed earlier, right?
Not if you’re going to make it sound like I’m extorting you.
Hah...
I don’t offer these things just to get you to like me, Sensei.
I want to have fun with you and I want {i}you{/i} to {i}want{/i} to have fun with me.
But I guess having you buy me dinner is enough fun for today.
Besides, any second now, lock.mp3 is going to play and Ami is going to show up.
Our conversation is suddenly interrupted by what may just be the last sound effect I ever hear.
What was that noise just now?
You heard that, right?
Either Ami is home way ahead of schedule or I am about to be robbed.
Neither of those things are good for me.
Which one of them do you think sounds good for {i}me{/i}?
The Ami one, obviously.
It would probably be safer getting robbed than having to deal with the fallout of her finding us together.
Jesus. What kind of relationship do you two have?
I’m home!
I’m going to die.
No...you’re not.
Do you have any idea how many times I’ve stealthily [masturbate]d in the same room as my sister, Sensei?
I’ll show you how good I am at being undetected.
Watch.
Umm...
What’s...going on here?
I was very hungry.
Don’t you think...this is a little much?
I thought Maya might be coming over when you got home.
Oh, okay. Then yeah, that makes sense.
Why are you back so early? I thought you were going shopping.
We were going to but...it was just way too cold and none of us wanted to wait at the bus stop.
So we all just decided to head back.
Cool, cool.
Oh, Sensei. I saw a nice pair of boots at the door. Did you buy those for me?
...Yes.
{i}For real? Those are my favorite boots.{/i}
Hm?
Did you hear something just now?
All I heard was the sound of my regret for not being able to wrap the boots I definitely bought you in time.
Do you...want me to go into my room so you can wrap them now?
...Yes.
Ami, bless her heart, is gullible enough to take the bait and disappears into her room for the next few minutes, giving Kirin enough time to flee the house.
Obviously, I didn’t make her walk home without her boots on, so now I just...need to figure out an excuse to give to Ami for why her “present” so suddenly vanished.
I don’t hear from Kirin again until she gets home- and even then, all I get are exhausted face emojis.
But, despite a rocky start, a rocky ending, and a...normal middle part (?) the evening isn’t a complete disaster.
It wasn’t ideal by any means, but I don’t think something like this will be enough to keep her away in the future...
{i}Kirin’s affection has increased to [kirin_love]!{/i}
